Lack enough support: The claim is supported by user videos and tweets that show the Facebook app opening the phone's camera in the background.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not provide any alternative explanations for why the Facebook app may be opening the phone's camera.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the opening of the camera is an inadvertent bug in the Facebook app rather than an intentional action.
Falters at times: The claim may falter in providing a comprehensive analysis of the issue, as it primarily relies on user reports and videos without further investigation or confirmation.
Understate: The claim may understate the potential privacy concerns and implications of the Facebook app opening the camera in the background.
Contradict fact: The claim does not appear to contradict any established facts.
Exaggerate: The claim does not appear to exaggerate any aspects of the issue.
